meta.name: description
meta.content: South Lane School District has 7 schools that caters to PK-12th grade in Cottage Grove, OR.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: South Lane School District, Cottage Grove Oregon SLSD, CG, School, public education, public school, South lane

div.aside: Today Governor Kate Brown announced she is extending Oregon’s physical school closures for the K-12 education systems through the end of the current school year. She directed school districts to complete the final weeks of the academic year by continuing distance education and support to students. We will begin our distance education on Monday, April 13. If your student has not already done so please have them check their email and sign into the google classroom for each of their teachers. We understand we have families without connectivity and we will provide student work for those families.

div.div: OSAA has officially cancelled all spring sports. Refunds of athletic fees for spring sports have been issued.

Additionally, the Oregon Department of Education released information regarding graduation requirements for 2020.The goal of ODE is to hold students harmless, recognize their accomplishments and protect future plans.

This guidance for Graduation Pathways 2020 relates only to current high school seniors, as defined by students who first enrolled in ninth grade in the 2016-2017 school year or earlier (including 5th or 6th year seniors). This guidance does not apply to students who first enrolled in ninth grade in the 2017-2018 school year or later, unless they have an early graduation plan that was approved before the Executive Order (EO 20-08) was issued on March 17, 2020.
This guidance provides options and recommendations to award credits for seniors that account for their work and accomplishments up to the point of school closure.

What’s Essential: Graduation Pathways 2020 Guidance
Maintain current Oregon Diploma, Oregon Modified Diploma, and Oregon Extended Diploma subject-area and credit requirements.

div.br:
Award subject-area credit based on a senior’s progress or demonstrated proficiency as of school closure (March 17, 2020). Award a diploma if a senior was on track to graduate prior to the closure.
Ensure opportunity for seniors to earn credit for course work or learning they have engaged with since the school closure.

Assign seniors Pass/Incomplete for all courses impacted by school closure. (Students not passing a course will be assisted by teachers in demonstrating proficiency for the Senior to receive a pass for courses required to earn a diploma).

div.div: Suspend all Essential Skills and Personalized Learning requirements for seniors. (Senior Boards)

We understand that the culminating events of our students senior year are extremely important. As such, we want to honor and celebrate our seniors and their accomplishments. With the knowledge that school is closed for the remainder of the school year we will begin planning specific events and creating alternative dates for when we can assemble in groups again. We will also get creative and plan other ways to celebrate our seniors soon!
We encourage seniors currently enrolled in College Now or AP courses to continue taking their courses in order to earn college credit. Teachers will provide further information.

We know the needs of our students and families are continuously changing. As your needs change please let us know by filling out the survey linked here: CGHS Survey . The survey will be posted on the high school website soon as well.
In closing, we understand this entire ordeal has placed undue stress on all of us, students and families, staff members, and our community. We thank you for your patience and understanding as we navigate uncharted territory. Our number one priority continues to be the health and safety of our staff members, our students and families, and our community. Students, we miss you!
